system.menu_admin_description: Configures various aspects of the Drupal Object Oriented Programming Framework
system.admin_build_oopmodule_description: Creation wizard for the OOP modules that will create all the necessary development files.

labels.settings: Email crypt symbol The symbol to use as a substitute of the @ symbol in the email crypt methods. You will probably have to clear the cache after having changed this value. Default language The default language for the Oop_Lang_Getter class, used in every OOP modules to get the language labels. You should probably leave the default value as most of the OOP modules should be written in english. General informations The general informations about the module (typically found in the .info file). Name The technical (short) name of the module (directory name). Title The module title, as displayed in the module list. Description The module description, as displayed in the module list. This will also be used to generate the 'help' hook. Package The module's package, used to group the modules in the modules list. Author Informations about the author of the module. Name The name of the author (will be written in the JavaDoc comments). Email The email of the author (will be written in the JavaDoc comments). Dependancies The general requirements for the module. Drupal version The minimum version of Drupal required to use this module. PHP version The minimum version of PHP required to use this module. Dependancies Dependancies on other Drupal modules, as comma separated list (do not include oop). Block Controls the block options for the module. Add block content Wheter the module has block content or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the block content. Description The description of the block content. Configuration Adds configuration options for the block content. Access The access arguments for the block content, as a comma separated list (eg. 'access example content, administer example'). Node Controls the node options for the module. Add node content Wheter the module has node content or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the node content. Description The description of the node content. Access The access arguments for the node content, as a comma separated list (eg. 'create example node, edit own example node'). Admin settings Controls the administration settings options for the module. Add administration settings Wheter the module has an administration settings page or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Title The title of the administration page. Description The description of the administration page. Settable number of blocks Wether the number of blocks can be set through the administration settings page (only relevant if the module has block content). Menu item Controls the menu items options for the module. Add a menu item Wheter the module has a custom menu item or not. The options below are only relevant is this checkbox is set. Path> The path of the menu item (eg. 'admin/mynode'). Title The title of the menu item. Description The description of the menu item. Access The access arguments for the menu item, as a comma separated list (eg. 'access administration pages, ...'). Writes the module
